page.title: 11THE SCHOOLS AT PURTON STOKE
page.content:
The children of Purton Stoke had to make their way to school in Purton in all weathers until 1894.A petition by the inhabitants resulted in the Board of Education deciding that a school should be built. Mrs N Storey Maskelyne gave the site and subscriptions were received from many residents.Mr.E.Barnes built the mixed elementary school for Â£600. The school was built to hold 100 pupils,
At first the average attendance was 70 but by 1977 the number was down to 26, so of course the school is now closed.
Once again children go to schools in Purton, the seniors go to Braydon Forest and the juniors go to St. Mary's C.E.school.
